job_title: JPM Payments- B2C Strategy and Transformation, Associate
job_Description: Job Description          The B2C Strategy and Transformation Associate will be responsible for building and executing strategic initiatives supporting the head of Global B2C's key goals and objectives. This individual will find opportunities and prioritize those among various initiatives to create a wholistic approach to strategy across all global products.         This individual will manage the end-to-end success of projects that include product positioning, competitive analysis, capability gap analysis, fintech partnership, new product capabilities and integration, marketability, and growth. Additionally, this individual will support establishing the product pricing structure for market-disrupting innovative products/offerings, ensuring the integration of systems and operations that interface with product strategy and sales/marketing programs. Key responsibilities of this position are to ensure that deliverables capture marketplace needs, meet customer expectations, generate incremental revenue from new and existing clients.         As a Senior Associate, the individual will be accountable for leading the success of a cross-functional team and managing expectations from various stakeholders. The individual will work closely with key Product Managers, Project Management Office, Fintech/Partnership teams, Sales/Relationship Management, Operations, Technology, Service and Implementations across the bank.    Responsibilities            Acting as an advisor to our stakeholders and using those priorities to generate projects for the team that can strategically deliver key insights and actionable items      Manage stakeholder expectations to deliver across various payments product lines      Understand and analyze client needs to develop associated product strategy (e.g., leverage APIs, AI and Machine Learning) to drive next gen innovation      Quickly learning new product and business knowledge in order to break down analyses and derive insights to provide key suggestions for stakeholders      Drive use case analyses including financial projection and sizing for new market opportunities from changing payments landscape      Is able to build relationships with and influence colleagues and LOB functions to meet deadlines      Conduct key capability gap analysis and provide recommendation for buy/build/partner decision      Analyze FinTechs to identify, engage and manage a portfolio of external partners with emerging technology and capabilities related to the growth agenda      Develop detailed project/program execution plans and tracking against milestones; problem solve issues that arise during the execution phase      Work closely with cross functional teams (e.g., Products, Sales, Tech, Ops, Legal etc.) to ensure partner implementations are on track and delivering against plan      Proactively educate the JPMorgan Payments organization on market developments and partner opportunities      Willingness to travel up to 25% of the time            Qualifications             Minimum 3+ years of work experience in consulting or other strategy focused position      Experience working in various facets of the financial industry with deep knowledge in current and future payments trends      Ability to assess skills and strengths across team members in order to appropriately delegate tasks while also monitoring workload capability to deliver materials on-time and with quality      Deep understanding and experience in payments industry or deep knowledge in innovative technologies      Experience / proven ability in leading key stakeholders to drive strategy projects; work with various stakeholders, analyze and synthesize findings, and communicate at the executive level      Ability to build financial models and develop business cases (e.g., new market and product initiatives, pricing, operating model changes)      Excellent written and oral communications skills required, including the ability to synthesize "the story" for executive-level audiences and adjust messages and style based on different audiences and agendas      Ability to translate product vision into phased design requirements followed by execution of a go-to-market product launch      Excellent time management, is entrepreneurial and a self-starter, with demonstrated ability to deliver results within condensed timeframe        JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.     We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.     The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.     As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.     Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

Description:     COMPANY OVERVIEW:     Trellance is the leading provider of data, analytics, and business intelligence solutions to financial institutions. Organizations use its technology and consulting services to meet the consumer finance expectations of today’s digital world, one that is increasingly driven by artificial intelligence and machine learning. The company’s patented enterprise data platform, Trellance M360, is the enabling engine behind digital transformation and member experience. Trellance was founded in 1989, and its Tampa headquarters features a modern office space with panoramic water and city views, covered parking, onsite car detailing, and a café. The company offers attractive compensation; medical, dental, and vision benefits; 401k with matching plus profit-sharing; and many more tools and resources.        Overall responsibility :     The Marketing Campaign Manager will help design, execute, monitor, and improve our integrated marketing campaign approach for our personas across all segments. The individual will produce compelling and relevant campaigns that deliver thought leadership, engagement, traffic, and leads, driving acquisition and customer retention.        ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:         Collaborate with key stakeholders in marketing to design, strategize, execute, and optimize a data-driven demand generation campaign strategy to achieve our goals.      Work closely with the digital marketing manager on campaigns through all digital channels targeting key segments to generate new business and increase penetration within key accounts.      Develop account-based marketing campaigns, including crafting funnel strategy, developing audience segments, Ideal Customer Profile, building email and direct mail messaging, owning top-funnel lead generation, and measuring results.      Manage and execute all webinars.      Dive deep into data within 6Sense, HubSpot, and Salesforce to provide visibility into marketing campaign results, measure campaign effectiveness, and drive strategic decision making.      Collaborate with product marketing managers and event team managers to identify and execute marketing campaigns across channels.      Establish clear processes and document and scale processes across teams.      Define and implement best practices in campaign marketing management.      Build tight relationships with the sales organization, ensuring campaign enablement, and proper hand-off for successful follow-up for each campaign.      Regularly track campaign engagement in top accounts.      Stay current with marketing best practices, vet new marketing vendors and partners, and suggest new campaign ideas to further engage prospects.      Other duties as assigned.     . Requirements:       Minimum Education/Experience:  Bachelor’s degree (BA or BS) from an accredited college or university plus a minimum of four (4) years of experience in the related field preferred; alternatively, a high school diploma or equivalent plus a minimum of seven (7) years of experience in the related field.     Basic Qualifications:         5+ years of experience in campaign marketing or similar role, preferably in the financial services or fintech industry.      5+ years in B2B marketing.      Experience in managing multiple marketing campaigns across different channels.      Experience working with data, analytics, reporting.      Highly skilled in project and time management.      Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.        Preferred Qualifications:         7+ years’ experience in marketing or marketing campaign management.      HubSpot, SalesLoft, 6Sense, Salesforce, and Asana experience.      Experience working with lead scoring.      Highly organized and detail-oriented with the ability to prioritize multiple projects at a team level.

WHAT YOU'LL DO     We’re looking for a passionate and talented Data Engineer to join our rapidly growing People Analytics team that will design and build the infrastructure needed for the team to both automate existing reporting and deploy maintainable advanced analytics solutions such as real-time analytics and machine learning. You’ll be a key player in the team’s evolution, responsible for leading the development of data architecture needed for the team to design, build, and deploy cutting-edge analytics solutions, which will have massive impact by improving BCGers' lives, solidifying BCG as the employer of choice, and growing BCG as a business.    Examples of common activities include:         Meeting with a cross-functional Agile team to define business needs and supporting infrastructure      Creating and establishing design standards and assurance processes to ensure compatibility and operability of data connections, flows and storage requirements      Building foundational extract / load / transform processes in our Snowflake Data Factory (using dbt) to manage and store data from internal and external sources leveraging distributed and local structures      Developing tools to facilitate data integration, analytics, data cleaning / transformation, and the deployment of ML/AI models      Defining and developing advanced security models such as row-level security and tokenization      Proactively raising data issues and taking action to remediate      Supporting users in identifying the correct data sets and providing easy to use tools to pull data        The responsibilities will evolve over time as the needs of the business evolve.     YOU'RE GOOD AT         Solving challenging problems and are excited to positively impact BCG through People Analytics      Understanding business and analytics needs and designing an architecture solution to meet those needs      Successfully distilling complex infrastructures and processes into simple, clear visualizations and able to explain sophisticated data concepts in an understandable manner      Optimizing and enhancing computational efficiency of platforms supporting algorithms & analytics      Juggling competing priorities, including prioritizing your own work and seeking input where required      Guiding non-technical teams, with experiencing applying analytics at scale, infrastructure as code, and best practices for robust product development      Brainstorming and working jointly as a team, but you can also own your work and drive activities independently. You seek feedback and development and take ownership for mistakes.        You are skilled in:         Database modelling - applying database modelling concepts (e.g. ER diagrams), database modelling tools and languages using database connection tools and methods for SQL databases (e.g. dbt, MySQL)      Data cleansing, data curation, data harmonizing & packaging - cleaning data, identifying relationships between data, pattern recognition and web scraping      Data engineering – data manipulation and productization of the use of data. Topics include dimension reduction, feature engineering, tagging / annotation      Descriptive and diagnostic analytics and reporting      Development and coding skills, including modular coding & pipeline automation, integration programming, source Code management, development tools        YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)     In addition to the skills/strengths identified above, candidates must have:         Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or relevant field      2-3 years of experience as a Data Engineer in a commercial setting delivering analytics solutions      Experience working with Agile development methodologies and ceremonies      Fluency in SQL-based technologies (e.g PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL technologies (e.g. Neo4j)      Commercial experience supporting deployment of machine learning algorithms (ML Ops)        YOU'LL WORK WITH     You will work on the Advanced Analytics cadre within the NAMR People Analytics Team. You and your colleagues will combine innovative skillsets in computer science, artificial intelligence, statistics and machine learning with deep industry expertise. Along with this cadre, you will work with the Business Analytics and Enablement cadre to own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, building fact-bases, designing innovative algorithms, creating scale through designing, building, and deploying of analytics solutions, and training colleagues and clients on new solutions.    You will also work closely with the global Data Factory team, members of the NAMR People Team, and analytics colleagues in other regions. You will have significant exposure to and help drive impact on behalf of the North America Leadership Team (NALT). Depending on your project mix at a given time, you will work closely with specific colleagues in functions, geographies, or business units to drive priorities forward.     ADDITIONAL INFORMATION     Candidates should be aware that BCG currently maintains a policy requiring all US & Canada based employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. BCG is an equal opportunity employer and will provide a reasonable accommodation to those unable to be vaccinated for medical or religious reasons where it is not an undue hardship to the company to do so as provided under applicable federal, state, provincial and local law.

Full cycle recruiting experience ( candidate engagement through offer management)      Knowledge of Boolean, x-ray searches and additional sourcing software/tools      Prior experience managing and prioritizing multiple searches, projects and customer relationships      Prior experience working with recruiting and people-related tools              Job summary    A niche, specialty technical innovation team under the broader Amazon Music and Advertising umbrella is expanding. With the growth of the business, the team is looking for a motivated technical Senior Recruiter who will own the expansion of several business areas in support to unique and peculiar business initiatives.         As a Senior Technical Recruiter, you will manage the full search life cycle, including market insights, candidate and pipeline relationship building and stakeholder management. You will contribute to the measure of success, including key goals, benchmarks and metrics that align with the overarching goals of the business.         This is an excellent opportunity for a recruiting leader looking to deepen their experience in specialized technical recruiting, touching domains such as Engineering, Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Vision and Design.        Our team culture is goal-oriented, fast paced and fun! We are motivated by the challenge (and success) of hiring top talent for the ever expanding Amazon Ads & Music organization.                Key responsibilities include:            Partnering with the business leadership to build effective outreach, assessment and delivery strategies to attract bar raising talent      Driving interview process, calibration and candidate negotiation      Owning stakeholder communication (pipeline and measurable success metrics reporting)      Partnering with adjacent recruiting teams to drive internal operational efficiencies and specialized search initiatives (candidate experience, DEI growth + creative marketing)      Sourcing and partnering with external vendors to support the overall growth goals        Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.         Work/life Balance         Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.         Mentorship & Career Growth         Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.               Prior experience working with recruiting and people-related tools and systems, including applicant tracking systems, resume databases, internet sourcing tools      Experience with interview and offer management      Experience building close relationships with clients as a trusted recruiting business leader and partner                    Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Are you  a self-starter with demonstrable experience as a successful Data Analyst in the financial, technology or fintech industry? Then FlexShopper has an exciting opportunity for you!     About FlexShopper     FlexShopper, LLC, a wholly owned subsidiary of FlexShopper, Inc. (Nasdaq: FPAY) is a financial and technology company that provides brand name durable goods to consumers on a lease-to-own (LTO) basis through its ecommerce marketplace (www.FlexShopper.com) and LTO payment method. FlexShopper also provides LTO technology platforms to retailers and e-tailers to enter into transactions with consumers who want to obtain durable goods, but do not have the available cash or credit.     At FlexShopper, we believe in treating our consumers fairly and with respect. Our diverse and inclusive team believes in working hard together while enjoying a balanced work-life experience. FlexShopper headquarters is located in beautiful Boca Raton, Florida, and our Atlanta, Georgia division enjoys working from our stunning new offices in The Battery Atlanta. Teams at both locations enjoy an accessible, fun, and fast-paced onsite work environment, where we feel comfortable collaborating with colleagues at all levels of the #FlexFam. We're creative and dedicated self-starters who are happy to be a part of a growing innovative FinTech company.     Our benefits package includes competitive compensation, health insurance, vision, dental, and 401k with 100% employer match up to 4%* with immediate vesting after 90 days. Our Paid Time Off plan provides 7 days after only 6 months of service and 3 weeks of PTO after just 1 year! We also offer optional disability and life insurance, pet insurance, EAP resources, commuter passes for the Tri-Rail, flexible work arrangements, frequent rewards and recognition activities, a casual dress code, free gourmet coffee/tea and snacks in the break room and company subsidized gym memberships.     Position Summary : The Data Analyst will cooperate in FlexShopper's highly collaborative, fast-paced startup environment and contribute to the team and the organizations success. The Data Analyst is responsible for overseeing the collection, storage, and interpretation of data for businesses. Their duties include the clustering, categorization, and visualization of data as well as writing reports and summaries. Reporting directly to the VP of Risk and Analytics, this person will support our data-driven decision-making process here at FlexShopper. This is a full-time onsite position based in either our Boca Raton, FL or Atlanta, GA office.     Essential Duties and Responsibilities:     Quantitative Data Modeling:         Works directly with various multi-disciplinary areas to identify and analyze potential risks, rewards, and opportunities that exist within FlexShopper's operating landscape      Works with leadership to communication, create, develop, execute, and maintain data models that accurately analyze and represent risk exposure of a given enterprise risk      Selects Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) based on given risk drivers and root causes. Establishes benchmarks to generate insights, identify trends and aberrations      Accurately documents work products to perform data and risk/reward impact analyses      Assist development of statistical and machine learning models to solve business problems and derive actionable business insights        Data Visualization:         Works together with leaders and all stakeholders to effectively visualize the data analysis for use by institutional leadership in strategic decision-making      Responsible for creating, developing, and maintaining reports and/or dashboards in a data visualization tool such as PowerBI or Tableau      Assists in the development and implementation of efficient tools, which enhance Flex Shoppers operational framework        Data Collection and Management:         Coordinates with appropriate stakeholders to acquire data for analyses      Establishes and performs data collection and quality assurance processes to accurately track risks and issues      Automates data collection and aggregation      Aggregates key metrics across the company, corporate risk services, line of business liaisons, and other risk partners to update risk profile dashboards on a continuous basis      Creates records for new metrics (i.e., descriptions, metric owner, and linkage to risks) and properly archive retired metrics        Supervisory Responsibilities: No     Education, Experience and Skills:     Education and Experience:         Undergraduate degree and/or graduate degree in a STEM discipline (especially Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Statistics) required      At least two years financial industry experience preferred        Communication Skills:         Creates strong partnerships with team members throughout the organization      Presents findings to all levels of leadership and has superb communication skills, both written and verbal      Answers complex analysis-related questions in a public setting      Creates clear documentation of standard operating procedures and best practices      Researches and recommends best practices, tools, and methodologies for ongoing improvement      Advocates Security, Information Privacy, and Risk Management policies, practices, and procedures      Solid written and oral communication skills, combined with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills        Industry Software/Analytical Skills:         Proficiency in analytical and/or statistical software (e.g., SAS, SQL, R, Python)      Experience using R or Python for modeling and data analysis preferred      Experience in code versioning using GitHub or similar preferred      Understanding of machine learning, predictive modeling, math, and statistics preferred        Core Competencies for Success:     To perform this job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:         Communication, interpersonal and collaboration skills with the ability to influence, persuade and educate others based on data science expertise      Strategy, Analysis & Logical reasoning skills / Drive engagement and continuous improvement through applying data-driven problem-solving skills      Determined, highly focused and Adaptable / Remains calm under pressure when dealing with constant change      Curiosity / Growth mindset who can thrive independently as well as in a team setting        Notifications and Disclaimers:     To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to perform the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.     The duties and responsibilities described in this document are not a comprehensive list. The scope of the job may change, and additional tasks may be assigned as necessitated by business demands.     Physical Requirements:     Individuals may need to sit or stand for prolonged periods working on a computer. The role may require you to walk, primarily on a level surface, for periods during the day. The job may also require reaching above shoulder heights, below waist or lifting up to 15 pounds to file documents or store materials throughout the day.     Work Environment:     The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. For the most part ambient room temperatures, lighting and traditional office equipment as found in a typical office environment. This is a full-time onsite position.     Travel Required: NO     EEO Statement:     FlexShopper is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID:  59938        Our reliability is one of the best in the nation, and we’re working to make it even better. We live here too. That’s why we’re committed to making Florida a better place. Join our team today Learn more        Position Specific Description        We are seeking very capable individuals wishing to marry their strong passion and aptitude for the leading edge of data science with a desire to expand the promise of innovation and renewable energy.        The successful candidate will bring to bear considerable academic credentials and a deep portfolio of experiences. The role reports directly to the Director of Enterprise Data Science & AI Strategy for NextEra and, as such, the Data Scientist is expected to serve as a thought leader and play a key role in envisioning, developing, and deploying the data science and AI solutions that help NextEra continue to be recognized as the most innovative and successful renewable energy company in the world.     A successful candidate will be comfortable in a fluid, entrepreneurial, and very high-paced environment, but one that is focused on developing reusable software applications, not bespoke analytical solutions. We look for problem solvers with a history of demonstrated excellence.     Our team is focused on building successful careers. As such, the successful candidate will have an opportunity to participate in a myriad of projects and career-shaping experiences working alongside some of the most innovative minds in Energy.        Preferred Experience:         Developing data models and algorithms best suited to a particular scenario      A self-starter: you have started something on your own before - an open-source project, a new project within a company, a start-up, or something else.      Exceptional business background (e.g., managing client relationships on technical projects)      Assessing the effectiveness of the data model      Using different data gathering techniques      Keep up-to-date with the latest technology trends      Use modeling to improve customer experience by optimizing work schedules and events      Develop processes and/or tools to monitor model performance and accuracy      Extending company’s data with third party sources of information when needed      Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis      Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner      Communicate results and ideas to key decision-makers           Preferred Qualifications and Technologies:         Experience with Machine Learning techniques (classification, regressions, feature selection, etc.)      Experience with natural language processing and computer vision tasks leveraging deep learning techniques (tensorflow, pytorch)      Programming skills that allow you to be self-sufficient in handling data (Python, SQL, Scala, Java)      Experience with large datasets, distributed computing, and cloud-based environments (Hive/Hadoop, Spark, AWS, SageMaker)      Experience with statistical tools, packages, libraries (R / Spark / H2O.ai / scikit-learn)      Knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts      Present information using data visualization techniques                          Job Overview                  This position is responsible for developing algorithms, modeling techniques, and optimization methods that support many aspects of NextEra and FPL business. Employees in this role use knowledge of machine learning, optimization, statistics, and applied mathematics along with abilities in software engineering with a focus on distributed computing and data storage infrastructure (i.e., “Big Data”). job_title: NLP Engineer at Speech to Text Start Up
job_Description: Who is Recruiting from Scratch: Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. In addition, we are making virtual meetings accessible to all employees - allowing team members with disabilities to participate in a world that is now dominated by virtual meetings. Need to Have M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent Strong programming skills with working knowledge of Python You have 1-3 years of experience working on neural network based NLP Familiarity with the state of the art in deep learning Working knowledge of TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar frameworks Experience working in a Linux environment Team player with good communication skills (oral and written) Preferred Qualifications Ph.D. in Computer Science, Speech/Language Processing or Machine Learning Experience with MapReduce, Spark, or similar frameworks Experience building crawlers Experience administering Linux clusters Experience developing web applications Employee Benefits Stock. Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?                      Then BHG Financial is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.                      At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.                      With over 20 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.                  Who You Are                   As a Senior Analyst of Portfolio and Collections Analytics at BHG, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to major company challenges. You will work with a team of world-class professionals to develop and test strategies that ultimately impact the bottom line. And you will do it in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibilities, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation.                            What You’ll Do             The Sr. Portfolio and Collections Analyst will help establish and maintain effective portfolio performance tracking; identify improvement opportunity, form hypothesis, proposes, design, and implements tests to drive strategy enhancement and optimization.  The Sr. Portfolio and Collections Analyst will assist in the development and implementation of advanced analytics including portfolio risk analytics, loss forecasting, and machine learning algorithm and recommendation to solve business problems.  The Sr. Portfolio and Collections Analyst operates as a subject matter expert on statistical analysis, test and design of experiment, analysis methodology, modeling & application, and financial impact analysis.  The Sr. Portfolio and Collections Analyst collaborate with cross-functional partners to understand their business needs, formulate and complete end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables, and presentations.  Manages multiple priorities, communicates business performance and project progress to management & business partners, including the delivery of actionable findings and recommendations to multiple levels of leadership  Develops and automates reports, iteratively builds and prototypes dashboards to provide insights at scale and create visual displays of quantitative information, solving for analytical needs.  Facilitates implementation of work product and ensures accuracy.  You will also be responsible for mentoring junior team members.                          What You’ll Need             3+ years of experience in business analysis in a corporate setting, specifically in Credit Risk Strategy, Loss Forecasting, or Portfolio Analytics  3+ years of experience in Collection Strategy, Optimization, Modeling/Data Science, or related is a plus  Proficient with writing SQL queries, Python/R, Power BI, Tableau, Excel, and PowerPoint  Strong analytical, problem solving, and critical thinking skills  Intellectual curiosity and aptitude to pick up new technical skills and domain knowledge  Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance  Bachelor's Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering  Master's Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering is a plus                          Life at BHG              At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the wellbeing and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.                  Why You Should Join BHG              We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified. Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include:                       100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums       Competitive PTO and vacation policies       Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year       On-site gym access and memberships, with personal trainers, and certified nutritionists on staff       Company-sponsored training and certification opportunities       Monthly award ceremonies where top achievers are celebrated and receive additional bonuses       Ongoing volunteer opportunities to give back to the community through our BHG Cares program                             If you’re ready for a career where you can exercise your passions, be surrounded by co-workers who are relentlessly committed to service, and have a team-player mindset, apply today!                           ** All Remote employees at BHG Financial are required to work within the United States of America.                            BHG Financial is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. BHG Financial is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.                   #LI-Remote

job_title: Innovation Analyst - Sonnedix Europe location or Miami
job_Description: To apply, please submit a CV and Covering Letter explaining how your experience matches the requirements of our position and how your personal motivators and values align to Sonnedix purpose.                                         Vacancy Name          Innovation Analyst - Sonnedix Europe location or Miami                   Location          London                   Location Country                   Profile          The Role             Inquisitive and commercially astute, with a talent for translating complex data into actionable insight, the Innovation Analyst evaluates a range of innovation initiatives and market trends such as hybridisation of renewable energy, use of AI and machine learning, to support projects that drive growth within a global solar power producer that is committed to a net zero future. Reporting to the Head of Innovation, the Innovation Analyst identifies, develops and interprets trends, relationships and insights to understand the size, scope and opportunity in the market space being assessed. Working with various internal team members and external stakeholders, they prepare and present investment cases by collecting market data and relevant information, conducting analysis and synthesizing this into detailed insights, with a commercial understanding of the implications from insights and actionable opportunities.             The Innovation Analyst will align with the Strategy team to monitor the renewable and technology sector and wider market developments to provide data and projections based on trends, threats, opportunities and future expectations. Their agile growth mindset will enable them to gather, assess and connect knowledge on a wide range of new projects and challenges over time across a range of topics and geographies. Drawing on their solid understanding of how financial structuring decisions impact corporate risk, they will research projects and initiatives by engaging internal stakeholders and potential external partners, assess various innovation initiatives, with guidance from the Head of Innovation, to inform a prioritization and assessment framework. The Innovation Analyst will develop and co-ordinate implementation plans under the guidance of Head of Innovation for various innovation initiatives, and will develop and monitor metrics to track the progress and effectiveness of innovation plans including individual project and overall progress metrics, innovation forecasts and reviews, presentations and reporting.             Desirable skills                  Previous experience in corporate innovation or a similar role, preferably in an area related to the energy transition.             Investment analysis, and experience in developing, interpreting and presenting analytical reports and evaluations             Masters degree or equivalent qualification in business, finance, marketing, or a related field             Systematic, structured and rational approach, along with excellent communication and relationship management skills.             Fluent in English, and additional languages such as Spanish, Italian, French or German are an advantage.                    Local Language Job Description                   Description          Sonnedix welcomes applications from people of all backgrounds and members of under-represented groups             What we offer:            As the company grows, we offer the opportunity for you to grow with us through a wide range of training and development opportunities             Give back to the local communities through our comprehensive ESG agenda, volunteering days and charity events             Join a team that crosses functions and geographies through our off-site events, team socials and global celebrations             Coaching and mentoring opportunities             Options to work across functions and exposure to all parts of the growing business             Fantastic office environments             Be part of our drive to achieve sustainable growth and be carbon neutral by 2021             Unlimited access to the FIT app and regular well-being seminars             We supply office equipment to make home-working environment as productive as possible, such as chairs, monitors, keyboards, lamps             Many more local benefits, specific to each country              About Us:       At Sonnedix, our purpose is to harness the power of the sun to build a bright future - for our company, our partners, our communities and our planet. Sonnedix develops, builds, operates and manages solar PV plants for the long term.             Sonnedix is majority owned by institutional investors advised by J.P. Morgan Asset Management. Our track record and financial strength enable us to build trusted relationships with customers and partners, to smartly expand the adoption of solar and play a vital role in the energy revolution. We are proud of our diverse team of experts, the clean energy we generate and to make a positive difference for the communities where we operate. Hear from some of our team about Sonnedix: https://www.sonnedix.com/careers             Please submit your CV in English             Not the role for you but interested in joining us? Visit our careers portal as we are growing fast: https://solaris-hr.secure.force.com/recruit                   Applications Close Date

job_title: Regional Sales Representative (Remote - Marine Industry Experience)
job_Description: Are you looking to join a strong DMS sales team in the marine industry? Then come join our dynamic team as a 100% remote  Regional Sales Representative !     Who are we?     At the core of ZiiDMS, you’ll find a Powersports dealer management system built for real-time business intelligence, analytics, and retail management combined with AI and machine learning to help large dealers make informed decisions and take action to achieve profitability. It’s an exciting time to join our expanding team!     As a Regional Sales Representative, what might you do during a typical work day/week?         Focus heavily on new customer acquisition and revenue growth      Territory development, prospecting, sales cycle management, engaging, monitoring, and coordinating sales of the ZiiDMS product and services.      Learn and understand market trends and competitive product knowledge      Execute a sales strategy designed to exceed sales projections and provide feedback that is valuable to deﬁning future strategic changes      Engage prospects through the sales cycle to exceed sales goals by developing and maintaining a thorough understanding of our services/solutions and their applications towards solving customer business challenges      Accurately and consistently document all opportunities, status and updates in  SalesForce      Collaborate with other ﬁeld representatives, sales representatives, account managers, management, partners, and other support organizations to drive ZiiDMS sales initiatives.      Manage ZiiDMS sales with organizations by eﬀectively identifying and driving a number of opportunities through the qualification process to the eventual sale      Help build and leverage brand awareness and the ZiiDMS value proposition within your assigned territory      Travel to industry events when necessary        What do you bring to the table?         Marine  DMS experience required  (dealer or vendor)      Demonstrated experience in developing a large, diverse sales territory      Experience giving presentations      Experience selling via the following channels: video conference, online demo, webinar presentation, phone      Excellent computer skills, Microsoft Oﬃce product knowledge, as well as other industry software solutions, preferred      Ability to work in a remote environment        Is this challenge for you? The answer is YES if you…         Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills      Pay strong attention to detail and follow-through/follow-up      Consider yourself a self-starter with an entrepreneurial approach      Enjoy working independently      Consider yourself an engaged listener      Approach life with a positive, friendly, enthusiastic attitude      High level of professionalism      Ability to prioritize and be ﬂexible      Have the ability to determine customer needs and present the appropriate product and/or service solutions      Can influence others and present strong value propositions      Effectively communicate complex solutions to decision-makers.      Possess strong knowledge of strategic & consultative selling        If your experience includes any of these items, consider it “icing on the cake!”         Marine industry knowledge      SalesForce experience        ZiiDMS might be the company for you if you…         Desire to be part of something new, challenging and leading-edge      Want to work for a marine software company that continually strives towards new ideas and technologies      Like working with great people in a fast-paced environment      Enjoy great benefits such as a comprehensive Health and Wellness Program, matching 401k, and ample PTO.     Salary starts at $50k/year plus commission (OTE $100k+)        About DE            Dominion Enterprises (DE) is a leading digital marketing and software services company offering client solutions across multiple business verticals. Our customers rely on our B2B cloud SaaS solutions to establish their online and mobile brands, generate leads, and manage customer relationships through our Homes.com, Dominion Dealer Solutions, Dominion Business Solutions / DX1, Travel Media and Franchise and Business Opportunity divisions. Our B2C web and mobile applications include Homes.com, HotelCoupons.com, FranchiseOpportunities.com, FranchiseGator.com, Franchise.com, and BusinessBroker.net.   About 2,000 employees reside and work in our Norfolk, VA home office and in offices across the U.S.Â Our employees will tell you about our collaborative, innovative, team-oriented work environment, excellent career enrichment opportunities, community service opportunities, competitive earnings, and a comprehensive benefits package that includes a generous 401(k). DE is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse workforce. DE is a drug-testing employer.

Job Title:  Business Intelligence Developer Date:    01/19/22   Department:    Information Technology   Location:    Boca Raton   Reports To:    Director of Business Intelligence   FLSA Status:    Exempt   Summary:  The Business Intelligence Developer is responsible for designing and implementing enterprise BI solutions.   This individual is responsible for understanding business data, aggregating data, analyzing data, generating SQL views and procedures, generating reports and dashboards, data governance, and performing quality assurance testing to ensure the data presented is correct. This position will be an advocate as well as a tester of data quality for the organization, working with the rest of the BI Team to better integrate 3rd party applications.   The Business Intelligence Developer will support application development and database administration by; developing reusable and precise reports and dashboards based on processes and standards. You will contribute to the effective data governance of Vertical Bridge’s business data, including but not limited to data quality, data management, data policies, business process management, and risk management surrounding the handling of business data at Vertical Bridge.   Job Functions:       Partner and work closely with Product Owners, Business SMEs, and application development teams to understand reporting requirement    Gather and analyze data to develop insightful conclusions and generate solutions to address user needs    Develop Business Intelligence reports, data models and dashboards, analytical models, etc. using data from our major business systems    Ability to develop and support data integration frameworks    Ability to write manual and automated test plans; following and develop a formal test plan process, working closely with the business partners and Business Analyst to ensure the data meets expectations    Provide work estimates based on the scope of new and current features, and work iteratively in an Agile environment    Simultaneously manage multiple projects. Effectively communicate project status to stakeholders.    Demonstrate attention to detail, work well in a team environment, be highly motivated, and willing to learn new skills    Backup DBA in functions such as SQL backups and restore, grant user permissions, performance tuning, and maintain schema and data integrity throughout all environments     Supervisory Responsibilities:  None   Working Conditions and Physical Demands:    This position will work directly from the corporate office with minimal travel.   Minimum Qualifications:       A four-year degree (BA or BS), preferably in Computer Science or Engineering is required    Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analytics implementation, from requirements gathering with business partners, through development, testing, training, and implementation    Minimum 3 years hands-on experience with enterprise-level data platforms and functions; including but not limited to Microsoft SQL Server, Azure SQL, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory(ADF), Azure Functions, Analysis Services, Azure Synapse, Boomi, SQL Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Reporting Services (SSRS)    Minimum 3 years of extensive Microsoft Power BI implementation and development    Minimum 2 years of understanding Database Administration key concepts; optimization, backups, replication    Experience in the following areas are a plus:  NetSuite platform    Python, Data Science, Machine Learning, or Artificial Intelligence    GIS Spatial data analysis and implementation    Developing ESRI ArcGIS platforms    Boomi Integration platform    Comfortable working in Agile development manner with multiple priorities occurring simultaneously; working with shorter release cycle/continuous delivery environment    Work in a small team environment that takes on multiple priorities and responsibilities throughout the week with little to no daily management oversight    Need the ability to follow established company protocol and communication guidelines and be able to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment and work well within a team-oriented environment as well as being able to work independently    Strong analytical skills with a problem-solving aptitude     Vertical Bridge is committed to a policy of equal employment and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee. and suitability objectives such as being open, modular, extensible, maintainable, and reusable      Construction of solution-level systems models encompassing hardware, software, behavior, the technical and programmatic data in a project) / Model-Based Systems Engineering Certificate / DAU’s Digital Engineering for DoD Consumers Credential      Experience in the various sub-disciplines of DE (Agile MBSE, Mathematical ModSim, Dynamic ModSim, AI/Machine Learning, 3D CAD, 3D Printing, Virtual Reality/Augmented Reality)      Demonstration of in-depth understanding of the principles, technologies, and systems that fall within the purview of Eglin’s Armament Division and weapons acquisition      Demonstration of in-depth understanding of DoD 5000.02 and the adaptive acquisition framework      Top Secret/SCI Clearance            Additional Information:            Location: Eglin AFB, Odyssey’s Florida Office      US Citizenship required      Minimal travel requirements      Telework opportunities possible dependent upon Program Office requirements           #LI-KL1    Company Overview:         Odyssey Systems Consulting Group,  is an innovative small business committed CCOR Technology & Cybersecurity ("CCOR Tech & Cyber") is a group within the Compliance, Conduct and Operational Risk (CCOR) organization and has areas of alignment across all Lines of business (LOBs), Regions and Corporate Functions (CFs), responsible for the independent oversight of first line operational risk management practices and compliance with technology and cybersecurity laws, rules, and regulations. Additionally, CCOR Tech & Cyber provides Firmwide end-to-end independent second line coverage of Technology and Cybersecurity Compliance, Resiliency and Crisis Management, Insider Threat, and Global Supplier Services.         The Technology Compliance officer works in partnership with CCB Technology Operational Risk and as part of Tech & Cyber Compliance, Conduct and Operational Risk (CCOR) team to provide Risk Management through independent risk assessment, oversight, and advisory guidance to CCB Technology. Activities include evaluating the obligations of applicable Laws, Rules & Regulations and/or requirements to both existing technology and emerging technology (e.g., distributed ledger, machine learning, quantum computing etc.), as well as working with CCB Technology and CCB Product functions to appropriately account for technology risks in their control frameworks, including change management, cloud usage, outsourced activities, information security, electronic records management, regulatory reporting, cross-border data management.         This coverage is implemented through the execution of well-defined Compliance practices areas. Those areas include advising on applicable technology compliance risks and related policies, developing and executing testing and monitoring activities, performing the Independent Second-line Risk Assessment, and engaging with the regulatory change management program.         This role will work closely with CCB CCOR Technology Officers and Product Cabinet members, CCB Cyber and Technology Control Officers (CTC)/Information Security Managers (ISM), and CCB Technology Management. This role will likely engage with other subject-matter experts across Compliance, Operational Risk, Legal, Internal Audit, and others as needed.            Key Responsibilities:             Provide critical thinking and subject matter expertise regarding compliance relevant risk in the development and execution of Risk Management for CCB Technology.      Collaborate with counterparts in other LOBs and regions for a consistent global approach      Highlight compliance relevant risk against firmwide and CCB policies & standards through independent assessment and challenge      Manage compliance relevant risk through developing and/or executing monitoring and testing activities, creating issues, and supporting compliance training activities.      Provide clear communication, escalation of activities/risks identified through the execution of risk assessments and delivering advisory guidance to all relevant stakeholders.      Establish and maintain strong relationships and ongoing dialogue with key CCB Technology leaders, Technology Control Officers, Tech ORM, and other CCOR personnel            Qualifications:             5+ years or more of proven experience with Technology standards (e.g. SDLC, Identity Access Management, Information Management)      Exposure to existing technologies and ability to identify and adapt potential risks to emerging technologies within Financial Services (e.g., Distributed Ledger Technology, Cloud Computing, Machine Learning)      Understanding of banking and securities rules and regulations (e.g., CFPB, OCC, FFIEC guidelines) and of regulatory expectations for a culture of compliance.      Proven track record of Risk Management (Compliance, Technology, Operations or relevant Control Function), preferably within Financial Services      Strong ability to prioritize, work under tight deadlines and demonstrate initiative      Past experience building and maintaining key relationships across departments and functions, and encouraging a culture of engagement.      Outstanding oral and written communication skills with proven ability to communicate effectively at all levels and translate (e.g., in plain English) technical and/or compliance requirements between technical and non-technical audiences      Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, inquisitive nature and comfort challenging current practices      Exposure to current CCB Products is a plus        JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.     We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.     The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.     As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.     Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

We are looking for self-guided 5G Software Developers with a strong background in engineering and problem solving. You get to contribute to the development of incredible new technology with our clients in aerospace, secure wireless communications and many other spearhead technology industries.               You are an experienced wireless communications software engineer capable of driving specifications, designs, or development for new state of the art 5G mobile communications systems. You will also have the chance to participate in design, specification, or development of software products for communications systems including end to end 5G communications layer 1/2/3 system products. This position requires strong problem-solving skills focused on wireless communications software engineering.               Projects you will be working in require a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Not needed prior to starting. You will need to be a US citizen for consideration.               Ability to Work Remotely:  Part-time Remote Telework. The person selected for this position will be able to work part of their work schedule remotely. Some parts of work may also be at a designated customer facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process.                                                              REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS                                                               In order to thrive in the projects and building the state-of-the-art technology we are collaborating with our clients, you need experience in:                            General knowledge of 5G mobile comms architectures and base station components               Experience with software development for 4G or 5G Layer 1, 2 and 3 protocol stacks and higher application layers               Experience with integrating a wider software stack across multiple components, including new software, FOSS, and COTS               Experience with Java, Python, C/C++, Jira, Confluence, or github               Experience with Agile development methodology                                                    Other desired skills also include:                            Experience with full-stack, cross disciplined teams               Satellite communications (SATCOM) experience and knowledge about SATCOM protocol standards (e.g., DVB-S/S2/S2x/RCS/RCS2, Geo Mobile Radio, MUOS WCDMA etc.)               Knowledge of network management systems               Experience with DevSecOps practices and cloud architecture               Experience interacting with customers and vendors and presenting at requirements and design reviews               Modeling and simulation to establish feasibility and performance               Working with terminal modem chip vendors and base station modem vendors                           By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.                                                              WHY JOIN UNIKIE?                                                               Unikie is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.               At Unikie, you will get to work within an experienced and ambitious community in a global environment, that develops modern, secure solutions for pioneers in their field.               With us you get to work in challenging projects, and you also get to work in a flexible low-hierarchy organization where you get the chance to develop your skills in a superb group of people. In addition to our customer deliveries, we focus on our own R&D, where you get the opportunity to influence, if you want to!                                                              How to Apply                                                               If this sparked your interest, please send your application to jobs@unikie.com               Our recruitment team is happy to share you more information about Unikie and our open positions, so please drop us a line if you wish to discuss with us before sending your CV or have any questions in mind!                                                                                                                                                                                 LOCATION                                                              Coral Springs FL (USA)                                                                         Other locations are also negotiable.                                                              TAGS                                                              Java, Python, Embedded SW Development, C, C++, DevOps, Jira, Confluence                                                             About Unikie                                                               Unikie, founded 2015, is a modern age company in software industry. Unikie develops cutting edge technology solutions for automotive, secure communications and industrial domains. We focus on ADAS, telematics, analytics and machine learning solutions, software, algorithms and ultra secure communications and systems. With our software and competence, our clients can accelerate their R&D to a completely new level.               For us, transparency, taking responsibility from our work, working together and putting clients and results first are an important part of our business and also guide our operations as our company values. Just a couple words about numbers – since our founding, our revenue has grown quickly while we have also been able to maintain profitability. Experience working with cross-functional project teams and managing communications including in-person or virtual meetings is preferred. The role of Manager, Order to Cash Operations located in Tampa, Florida will be responsible for the management of the Order to Cash (O2C) process at Amyris. This is a fantastic opportunity to build a strategic O2C operation that will proactively identify process improvements, modernize core systems and reimagine the business with digital solutions. Applications include SAP, NetSuite and Concur.                  Amyris is experiencing tremendous growth whereby we have created a new way of working through the establishment of the Amyris Business Center (“ABC”). As a member of ABC, your role will participate in the strategic implementation of our shared services model. Come in on the ground floor of an exciting initiative to transform the way our operations are carried out across our Finance, Procurement, HR and IT groups.                  Join Amyris Business Center (“ABC”) and work directly to:                  Increase collaboration and knowledge sharing                   Enhance our current policies                   Share and develop further subject matter expertise                   Align processes company-wide                   Standardize how we handle integrations and onboard new business                   Achieve operational excellence                     Responsibilities:             Supervise team members of the Order to Cash team.  Full ownership of the Order to Cash process, including credit risk analysis, invoice resolution, deductions, collections and cash application.  Provide direct support for processing day-to-day customer management processes including replying to customer queries, customer statement reconciliations, and month-end close processes.  Provide excellent business partnership to internal clients and external customers.  Collaborate with the revenue accounting team to ensure uniformity in application of accounting standards and internal policies.  Manage processes to ensure accurate and complete customer onboarding and master data management.  Ensure all in-scope activities are compliant with company policies and internal controls, with robust supporting documentation.  Implement enhanced customer collections processes and build relationships with customers in the process.  Manage customer deductions including credit notes, while maintaining a clean customer account.  Provide guidance to team in resolving escalated issues related to the O2C process.  Partner with technology and applications teams in implementing EDI feeds with customers, new 3rd party applications and system upgrades.  Manage sales tax filings processes according to statutory deadlines.  Generate reports for review such as exception reports, accounts receivable aging reports, bad debt write-offs and other month-end reports as requested.  Assist, obtain and provide financial information needed for internal and external quarter review and periodic audits.  Identify opportunities for automation that will create efficiencies to enable high growth.  Support team members through the successful completion of O2C related projects.  Monitor and enhance controls environment in accordance with SOX.                          Required Qualifications:             6+ years of experience with Order to Cash, Accounts Receivable processes.  3+ years of people management experience.  SAP and/or NetSuite proficiency is required.  Solid understanding of US GAAP.  Familiarity with 3rd party or native Credit and Collections applications.  Proficiency with Word and Excel and efficient data entry skills.  Strong customer service orientation and ability to successfully deal with external customers and internal clients.  Ability to perform in a fast-paced environment.  Ability to drive continuous improvement.  Absolute integrity and the use of good judgment to handle the confidential nature of duties, tasks and information.  Adept at time management, ability to meet critical deadlines.  Strong communication skills both verbal and written.  Excellent written and verbal skills.  Embrace Amyris Core Values.  Adherence to Amyris Safety Policies and Procedures.                          Preferred Qualifications:             BA/BS in Accounting or related field - CPA preferred. Who We Are     SBA Communications (SBA) is an industry leader in providing the wireless infrastructure that makes communication work, with a track record of growth throughout the Americas, South Africa and Southeast Asia. Our purpose is to enable the communications that are essential in connecting people. We are listed on NASDAQ under the symbol SBAC and our organization is part of the S&P 500. SBA is also one of the top 20 Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) based on market capitalization.     The People     Our success stems from our collaborative environment, where differences are appreciated and our team members are considered our most valued asset. Together we uphold the highest moral and ethical standards, are excellent stewards of our financial resources, we prioritize quality and we do things right the first time. We innovate new, efficient and effective ways to do business, and we go the extra mile to provide excellent customer service to our clients and to each other. We enjoy each other’s company and we work hard to make those around us successful.     The Perks     One of our values is to be People Focused, and as such, we are committed to our team members current and evolving needs through our global compensation and benefits programs. Our strategy is to provide programs and resources focused on four pillars of overall well-being: Physical, Emotional, Financial and Social. We enable our team members to stay healthy with medical, dental and vision insurance options. We help our team members navigate their path towards financial security through our 401K Retirement Plan, Global Stock Ownership and Employee Stock Purchase Programs. Additionally, we provide Paid Time Off (PTO), Tuition Reimbursement and many other impactful benefits.     Your Next Career Opportunity – Robotic Process Automation Developer    The Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Developer will be responsible for developing complex automation solutions using a variety of methods in support of automation initiatives. Collaborates with the end users as well as team members in design, development, testing and maintenance of automation projects across the organization. Able to engineer process patterns for the purposes of creating reusable assets within architecture. Utilizes process automation best practices to ensure automations meet business requirements and meet stated targets for efficiency. Must be able to consult on and/or develop multiple automation projects and ensure delivery within the given timeline.     What You Will Do – Primary Responsibilities         Deliver excellent service through actively learning the company’s business and business processes, responding to the needs of the internal customers, and following through on commitments.      Develop, troubleshoot, and enhance Robotic Process Automation (RPA) processes serving the entire organization.      Actively monitor current RPA processes, and suggest enhancements or modifications.      Provide guidance with process design.      Design, develop, and test automation workflows.      Deploy RPA components including bots, robots, development tools, code repositories and logging tools.      Support the launch and implementation of RPA solutions.      Create process and end-user documentation.      Assure the quality of the automation (QA processes).      Work with Business Analysts, QA Analysts, Process Owners, and other cross-functional resources to define and deliver business impacting projects.      Work directly with stakeholders to capture business requirements and translate them into technical approaches and designs that can be implemented.      Collaborate with development team members to ensure proper implementation and integration of the solutions.      Support deployments or troubleshoot production issues outside of work hours and participate in an on-call rotation as-needed.      Maintain current knowledge of relevant technologies and business processes.      Build enhancements to existing RPA solutions while following prescribed SBA ERP methodology and standardized SDLC practices.      Responsible for ensuring RPA systems are running on current software releases and conduct proper planning and test coordination for upgrades and maintenance.      Assist with the implementation of new software enhancements, system processes and/or 3rd party products from an automation perspective.      Maintain appropriate software on server and client development computers.      Provide advanced tier RPA support.      Ensure complete issue tracking and reporting is accomplished.      Actively manage, and maintain project plans (Microsoft Project) for current initiatives.      Maintain proper documentation throughout the software development lifecycle of assigned projects.      Participates in the creation of the supported software and hardware lists.      Responsible for making improvement recommendations to the TBD MANAGER TITLE concerning changes in business process, internal department process, and software development tools.      Accountable for enforcement of IT dept. standards, including but not limited to, proper design, project documentation, coding standards, and approval processes.      Provide timely and accurate responses to local and remote users’ concerns relating to RPA bots and solutions.      Must provide excellent customer service through end user training and SOX documentation.      Other projects and duties as assigned.        What You’ll Need – Qualifications & Requirements         Bachelor's Degree in IT or Accounting preferred;      and 0-2 years in any of the programming languages like C/C#, Python, VB Script, Ruby, Java, JS, .Net, basic programming knowledge on HTML, JavaScript (or any scripting language).      Able to design technical specification documents for RPA Projects      Experience developing consuming APIs      Experience with Agile development methodology      Applied experience writing T-SQL, stored procedures, and database views      Knowledge of artificial intelligence and machine learning      Must be able to read and create Microsoft Visio files, which include detailed step by step business processes      Understanding of workflow-based logic      Demonstrated knowledge and advanced proficiency working with Microsoft Office Suite software including Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint and Microsoft Outlook.      Certified as a UiPath Certified RPA Associate (Minimum)      UiPath Certified Advanced RPA Developer (Preferred)        Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities    The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.
